text:
@MichelleWitte7 omg. howww did I go this long not realizing all these symptoms lead back to ADHD?! 😫
this 31.5 years of thinking I was a klutz & letting people roast me about it
@blkgirllostkeys Turn most of them off. Texts are on (group chats silenced), reminders and calendar notifications on. My daily journal app is on. The rest are a surprise when I open the app!
RT @StructuredSucc: I'm sorry that I didn't get back to you, your email just had too many words and not enough blank space, so my brain tur…
@ADHD2ePro @AskADHD This is very true. I start my cycle this week, that’s a good explanation for current dreams! Bodies are weird

TLDR: YOU ARE YOUR OWN BEST ADVOCATE FOR YOUR HEALTH. If something seems off, not typical, discuss w/friends, quick research, talk w/GP & visit specialists if you are able. Knowledge is power, and today I am grateful for the internet. 

(white woman w/FT job privilege check)

and I found studies from @nih about it. My non-medically trained comprehension is it seems there IS a connection! My mind was blown/obsessed for at least an hour. Basically allergies signal overreaction immune response, white blood cells are part of the immune system, etc.

mild case & daily life wouldn’t be affected. Since then, the only thing I’ve wondered is if my cuts/scrapes heal slower than a human w/o neutropenia. I finally remembered to research it. Within 5 mins, I was down the neutropenia & severe dust mite allergy connection…

Dust mites-related discovery! Last spring-summer, I had routine blood work show low counts for neutrophils (type of white blood cell) & my GP recommended I see a hematologist. After more blood work & sonogram to check for liver inflammation I went, dr determined I had a chronic

Fun oldie childhood #ADHD symptom has returned: sweaty palms. Recently learned adderall and stimulants can make you hot, and therefore sweat. If only my 12y.o. self knew I should take off my jacket instead of suffering just to hide the sweat rings…😔
@ADHD2ePro @AskADHD Wow! It’s so great to know I’m not alone in this. Or I have “crazy dreams bc you don’t do drugs” as a former friend told me 😑
@nayrmada13 @AskADHD I brought it up to my psych once, he called them nightmares. I didn’t realize adults could still use that term for “intense” or “awful dreams”
@my_ADHD_life I feel seen. Look at our beautiful brains working overtime 🙃
@kool_memon @AnneBonny91 @AskADHD Wowww this is so cool! I’ve definitely had those kinds of dreams, more on an occasional basis, a few times a year. (Inception is one of my fave movies!)

Do any other ADHD’ers dream very lucidly with or without sleep medicine? #askadhd 

I have my entire life & meds make them more intense & memorable for days, weeks!
It is utterly amazing how much my brain fires the moment I wake up after a terrible night’s sleep #ADHD
RT @Sea11941760: I need to be on my phone less but when I feel drained it's too easy to just scroll
Blankets are my love language, consider this an expert opinion 😉

Sleep meds make me so hot & 🥵 
Last night was the first night since November I didn’t wake in the middle of the night bc I was sweating. I spent $45 on a cooling blanket yest & it WORKED! Blanket+cotton sheet=bliss! 

What I got: https://t.co/zvak8Zjh8s

@rauhling_bizzle Sitting on cold tile floor after a sitting on the floor shower. Take my time. Remind myself how much of a mess it will be if I don’t do it now. Tell myself I can lay down after it’s done.  (Former hairstylist)
#ADHD is taking your prescribed meds (Adderall for me), getting a burst of motivation to do The Thing, then taking a nap an hour later.
@JuleMarie1999 Gotta be in the mood for them. And always must be doing something else. Lately, I have only been able to listen to light pop culture stuff or music I already know
@Jo_ADHDefined I feel attacked 😲🫥

My therapist told me today, “Taylor, stop being so hard on yourself. Use thought-stopping tools”
I feel more intensely & dwell on the bad for days after the issue has been resolved. 
I learned dwelling piles on & prevents me from experiencing happiness 🙃 #depression #ADHD
@mrsblackattack5 @StructuredSucc Reading this just made me realize I do this too! constant interruptions…for a good reason ha
@ADHD_Auntie I feel this so hard. Hope you can get some solid rest tonight 💓
RT @lifeinunreality: would honestly like to win some kind of award for achieving something (anything!) while severely mentally ill. we all…
@birdbrainmd3 @theADHDacademic Oof. That must have been rough. Hope you’re doing ok. You are important!
@_am_or If I had patience pants to share, I would overnight them to you! Sending a big wave of hope to you NOW!

@theADHDacademic @birdbrainmd3 This just made me realize everything I did in the first 3 months of lockdown was a hyper focus: work projects while wfh, landscaping, house projects, refurbish furniture. And then I got depression!

This evening, I’m traveling out west to meet my four best friends for a few days. Two of them have referenced ‘getting blasted’ and hanging out at the bar at 1am the first night

This will be them 😦 when I remind them no, I **really can’t drink alcohol** bc of meds
@CandyCain100 This is me, 50 times a day
Sometimes I’m amazed I accomplish so much in a day. Mostly bc I forgot I did the things. #ADHD

@SouvikKundu88 @HackingADHD Yes! I get so unbelievably bothered by others trying to contact me in an app. I did this about 5 years ago, never turned them on. It helps me by not inviting my brain to jump around every 3 seconds; I do that on my own time😹

Honorable mention: the do not disturb function❤️

@HackingADHD THIS! I live with so few push notifications and red alert bubbles. All of social is off. Push notifs: texts, reminders, calls, app journal Daylio, parking (use it monthly).

I’ve found this to be extremely helpful, when my phone/watch buzz, I know it requires my attention!
Although I did prioritize making my dog rice on the stove for his upset stomach over eating anything with my meds. A chaotic day!
In the past hour, I thought I accidentally took my sleep meds along with my adderall, antidepressant and allergy pill. I’m not sleepy, so proceeding with life per usual 9-5’er
@ADHD_Alien Ahhh this is so accurate. Thank you for the work you share with us, it’s so insightful!
@torriantimms Haha yessss this happened to me the other day! Passed out on top of my made bed, clothes and makeup on 😐

@lifeinunreality High & Low energy, ready to burst

Ok, this is fun, thank you! I like word challenges
@lifeinunreality Where did the pinball go now?
@myadhdblog @AskADHD Nope, you’re definitely not the only one! 🙃
@SimpleBadger27 sounds freaking glorious. glad you got serious rest!
@lifeinunreality yesssss NDs love a quick fix for any and every isssue, inconvenience, serious or otherwise. so we spend spendy spend

@Sea11941760 YES! And how about when I was a kid/teen, my parents were always saying, “do you want to learn the easy way, or the hard way?” Sometimes rhetorical. Often ended up learning “the hard way” bc idk, my brain didn’t respond/work the way they wanted it to 🙄
@Sea11941760 exactly me.
@catmamaward_92 I think about this scene quite often, then wonder how close we are with technology to achieve this irl
@Sea11941760 ahhh so hard to do. perfect doesn’t exist, it’s extremely difficult to remind my brain of this fact. oftentimes “completed” is better than taking 100 hours to make it ~the best ever
@lifeinunreality WHAT is going on in here

@0vertheM0on you’re welcome! and oh my god this is awful! I am so sorry you’re suffering and have been medically mistreated. it’s so unacceptable. I hope you get some resolutions soon. And maybe stick it to the rude& inappropriate doctor with a 1-star G**gle review if you haven’t already😉
I wrote this when I was tired. Should have included #insomnia #depression tags in the first tweet. And highlights from the link: https://t.co/BpSgpy6osb

@blankinthought TY! My mind has been 🤯 since this afternoon! Must get an epi pen in order to take the Odactra, then take first dose at the doc’s office. If no reaction, daily, then follow up in 3 months. 
Can’t wait to tell my psych, therapist  & GP about this. Idk what it changes but damn ‼️
@blankinthought Oh my WOW zoiks ahhhh

@empressofcheer Yes! Combined with my cosmetology license and interest in the beauty industry, since I turned 18, my hair has been red + dark brown, medium golden brown, highlights + black lowlights, all over platinum highlights & now subtle golden highlights + ombre
RT @IsraaJN: Things your therapist wishes you told them. 🧵

@jessejanderson Uummmmm pay your water/sewer/trash bill on time. (Forgot it for the first time EVER!)

Also, write down or write and cross off the bills I paid 20 mins ago instead of click click clicking my cash away making double payments everywhere. Rough few months, yeesh

Maybe you want to know more about this ~mental & physical health connection~ I gained some more understanding from this article! 
(Didn’t fact check. It details what my doctor shared with me & at least has some words and phrases to search the interwebs) 💫https://t.co/y4f0axk3pa

Science is so cool how it can help all of us! Also, WTF my insomnia and depression might’ve been caused by freaking microscopic dust mites?! Like, my resting brain finally gave up on sleeping and functioning properly bc it was trying so hard to protect my body from the allergens!

⭐️ Moral of the story⭐️ ASK ALL THE QUESTIONS about weird shit your body does! I didn’t think my ear symptoms could be allergies until a new friend shared her allergy journey with me & suggested my symptoms might be allergies. It’s your body, do what you want!

I won’t even pretend to know technical things, this is all my understanding of what one doc told me. Starting Odactra soon, an oral medicine specifically for dust mite allergies (used to be shots 10 years ago). Doc said outlook is bright!

It can cause you to become a mouth breather and a slew of other things detrimental to sleep.
& insomnia can lead to depression…etc. 
I bought a new mattress Sept ‘21 thinking it would help my morning stuffiness. Wasn’t until I started daily Zyrtec that I wasn’t as runny/stuffy.

TLDR dr response: with a severe allergy response, your body is producing histamine for as long as you’re exposed to the allergen. That histamine reaches all your synaptic vesicles & neurotransmitters, ya know, your brain.

I had my follow up appointment with my doc today, and asked him about the mental health aspect bc I have all of the disorders from the paperwork. He agreed and said yeah, it’s totally possible dust mite allergies affected my mental disorders.

Last week, the allergy test showed I am SEVERELY allergic to dust mites (both species, who knew?). I took info papers home, and learned a dust mite allergy can lead to INSOMNIA, ANXIETY, DEPRESSION! (I have all three—but anxiety dx at the same time as ADHD age 11)

At my first visit, doctor said my eustachian tubes are inflamed. First, I tried the doc’s conservative approaches: Afrin + Flonase for 3 days. Then, started steroids a few days later for 5 days. Neither helped my symptoms, so the next step was a $500 allergy test 😵‍💫

Interesting stuff here 🧵

For MONTHS, my ears have been popping every time I swallow, just like after you get off a plane and want to relieve the pressure. The insides also itch every day. Occasionally, the popping/itching sends me into an anxiety spiral, so I went to an ENT.

@witlessX I toyed with using the word “feel” or “react” or something like that but I just want to notice changes. Currently I only have like 15% improvement on concentration. Biggest change is motivation, might be from increasing Effexor dosage 5 weeks ago.
Thank you!

Took my first full dose of Adderall tablet this morning (10mg in AM.) I swear it only helps with my motivation—I was extra chatty this morning & thru team lunch, but could easily turn away from a coworker & focus on writing emails

I don’t know how I’m supposed to react! #ADHD

Burned out on puzzles by mid-February (6/week obsession). Tried to reignite the passion and bought four (three were from an awesome designer’s collab w/Target). Even got a deluxe puzzle board. I want to love them again, it’s so calming. Halp! #ADHD #bored
Trust! Your! Process! 👏👏 https://t.co/rqzdsKWYXS
@LeRemedyy absolutely not. didn’t know one could teach another? I was raised “it’s every human out for themselves” vibes. not great
@NDTruthbombs This tweet made me realize this is a difficult thing to explain, maybe look into some “onomatopoeia” explainers
@TheADHDCafe Maybe I learned/heard something once. But I forgot. 😹😥
@poetswithadhd I hand write all my elevator speeches and answers to general questions about my experience. Several times. Get to interview early, sit in car and review for 15-20 mins

@catmamaward_92 I agree. I’m still kinda new to ADHD Twitter, yours is the first I’ve seen in such a similar situation. I’m the oldest child and I swear it’s the main reason I didn’t get the help I meeded
Morning after second night of no sleep meds: wow this really has me fucked up. Now I know how much I actually need them. Three more nights to go…
@catmamaward_92 I am in the same situation. This is such a bizarre thing/way to grieve and it’s really difficult. I hope you find moments of peace 🙂

Had to sleep without meds last night bc they can interfere w/my allergy testing on Wednesday. Woke up anxious this morning, although I’ve had moments of peace, still very shaky, tight chest. Going to shower and visit a friend for a little
@Sea11941760 same.
@AppleJaxxADHD Oh nooooo! I am so sorry. Hang in there 💓
Second day on baby dose of meds is going well. Except this morning I realized I need to consciously and methodically plan and schedule my food things! #ADHD
@AppleJaxxADHD @ThePixieEvil You speak the truth. I learn something new about  *ALL OF THIS* every day. Enlightening and terribly frustrating
@AppleJaxxADHD Ah, I see. I hope all of this means you are at a good spot with your meds 🥲

@AppleJaxxADHD Doc decided to treat depression & anxiety first get those under control before adding a stimulant. It’s been 3 months on Effexor, found my dose after 2 months. Slow approach to adderall, starting at 5mg 2x/day for 2 weeks so my brain doesn’t betray my body
@_ggushi Like clockwork! ‘I’ve worked so hard, why is there so much more to do’ sends me into a spiral damn near every time. Can’t focus on anything
Realization after second dose: time blindness has been accelerated 😱
RT @j0n_j0n: Adhd and anxiety....daily mental warfare at its finest
Started Adderall one hour ago. Already less chatty. Anxiety is present, like usual, tight chest. My brain is slightly calmer. #ADHD

Dear body, UNCLENCH. Don’t think about it, because that will make you tense again. Dear brain, don’t even start with me—count your diaphragmatic breathing

#ADHD is so fun
Well this makes me think and feel all the things. Can you see inside my brain? https://t.co/uz7Rq4uHvs

RT @jessejanderson: “Me, a perfectionist?
But I can’t ever get anything right.”
— a perfectionist
@AdultingADHD Literally have never thought about this. Starting meds soon for the first time as an adult. Your question provided insightful responses, thank you for asking!
@JayR_Xx *cackles* yes. too many times. you’d think I’d learn by now

Even my reminders have reminders! I just got three separate reminder notifications, all with about 10 minutes to call my doctor about which pharmacy to send my adderall prescription. My ADHD has ADHD 😹
@DexedrineDaily Prioritization of the things I want to do is the bane of my existence. I try so hard, yet…oooo shiny new hobby/activity I want to try right this second!

So grateful for my friend who was dx last year who has the 411 for meds in our city! 
Btw, this is in Florida. 🚨Adderall is like toilet paper in spring 2020🚨

ADHD IS… RAGE PACING in your office parking lot bc pharmacy A manufacturer isn’t currently making adderall, pharmacy B says they don’t receive it, pharmacy C won’t tell me if they receive it.  
My dr said they can’t just put in prescriptions to places until I find one💥
@KakarikoKat in the same boat. leaning towards MacBook Air. it all works so “seamlessly”

RT @annagranta: You'll never use a system consistently if the pain of using it is greater than the value it brings. 

ADHDers are more sens…
The only thing I could focus on today was pulling my hair and my problems, of course.

Damn this anxiety lasted all day! Thought it was the espresso, but surely the effects have worn off 12 hours later. Overwhelmed and underfocused. 

May or may not of screamed at the top of my lungs four times this evening. (felt great btw)
@PatriciaIrigo10 Oh, my friend, the list rarely is complete. So I just start over 🤪

ADHD is making a “weekend list” on Saturday morning and constantly adding new tasks throughout said weekend. Then thinking of a new task while working on another, and going to write ‘new task’ down and promptly forgetting. Over and over until the weekend ends. 🔃🔃🔃

Shocked that all of these feelings can exist simultaneously. and that I’m living proof. 

Thank you @Mollys_ADHD! https://t.co/BlooIL6FNP
@ADHD_MomLife yes Yes YEs YES x 1,000. I was dx as a kid, but no one ever explained how my brain works, or helped me understand symptoms as grew up. Freaking heartbreaking all of this tweet.
RT @ADHD_MomLife: Late diagnosis ADHD (@ 31, I’m 46 now) & realizing how much that + not fully understanding my ADHD symptoms undermined my…

@WhatTheADHD Did this the first week of Feb. I prioritized simple activities I ENJOY. Spent time w friends even when down & exhausted. Spent a lot of time outside. Had a couple dr appts. 3/5 great days, other 2: ok.
It was easy to exist. Focusing on me gave me patience to roll w the punches💓
@Sea11941760 love this for you! it’s so hard to do things without high expectations for ourselves
and handling MY health the way I want to. I wish everyone can reach the same autonomy, regardless of others’ opinions. ❤️

For the past month, I’ve wondered if I’m fixating on my ailments (tendinitis in knee, allergies affecting ears + mental health) & causing more. Decided NO today. That thinking is a product of “you’re fine” “tough it out” culture. So proud of myself for finally taking care of ME

@blankinthought omg ‘defrost’ that is genius! Im not very nice to myself, takes me a long time to notice it. Thanks for calling it out. Thought a little more about yesterday: it was a very anxious day, beginning to end

Had a few good days in a row this week. Had three dr appts yesterday (derm, psych and therapy) and a going away work party at a restaurant. Awful sleep last night, face and head hurt from grinding teeth. Took 1 hr to get out of bed. Something had to give 😞
@Sea11941760 @iputahexonyou Legit did not realize these were coping mechanisms until I wrote that tweet
@Sea11941760 @iputahexonyou I’ve recently brought notebooks to appts or tell them I have notes on my phone to reference. I also set reminders for the time of the appt w/the things I want to discuss

@adhdsomething Hi there! Try to remind yourself you’re doing your best, because you are! You are important. Take one thing at a time 😁 (also eyeROLL, so much easier said than done).
💓💓
I SANG in my car today! Like, out loud and I could hear myself enjoying my commute. I haven’t had this in over six months (time is weird, who can keep track when they got depressed?!)

@PatriciaIrigo10 Yes, actually I do! Only bc the anxiety of no longer having the money for the item I don’t like overpowers the lack of responsibility/forgetfulness. Anything tied to money makes me hyperfixate & super anxious. Usually a week or two goes by before the return 😉
@oldwiseman999 @Sea11941760 agree. people take what suits them in the moment, and leave what doesn’t. you are not a burden. your feelings and emotions are valid. tweet your thoughts.
@mcochrane_13 @eeeeeelizabeth @AskADHD and I wonder why I always lose my train of thought!
RT @mcochrane_13: @eeeeeelizabeth @AskADHD 🙋🏻‍♀️ typing, writing, speaking. My brain is always five steps ahead of my hands or mouth 🤦🏻‍♀️
@eeeeeelizabeth giant YES from me

@Sea11941760 Hey, a walk-in is worth a try! Bring a list of all the things you’ve tried & for how long. I used the phrase “I’m tired of waking up and hating everyone in the world for the last few months” and the doc went 😳
Also, I started SSNRI depression med the next week bc WHOA

@Sea11941760 I tried all of the tricks for so long: exercise, calming essential oils, weighted blanket, meditation apps, but nothing kept me asleep. I had a life-changing Telehealth w/ my GP, got a Trazodone prescription. Still don’t sleep thru night, but get mostly restful sleep. maybe 🍁🌱?
RT @PaulJRosen: Kids with #ADHD don't just have trouble "paying attention," they have trouble *not* paying attention. This is because their…

I have a follow up appt with my psych clinician tomorrow (and a derm visit and therapy session, ha!). I should be getting the script for Adderall and I am hoping taking it during the work week will improve my motivation & concentration #ADHD

Finally feel like my depression & anxiety med (Effexor) is at the right dose! I feel like my old self, the little dark cloud they show in commercials is not hanging over me every day. Keeping my distance from my boss. Exploring job opportunities. A medium-sized win!

@KBthatme @flexyouradhd @AskADHD This reminds me of how I used to have to wake up in high school (parents let me be, they wanted to sleep in). I had an alarm clock, TV timer, stereo timer and eventually cell phone alarm all timed in the 5ish minute gaps. I need to try this again! PLUS my dog 😆
@illy80HD Extremely relatable. You don’t want my expert opinion? ok I’ll go crawl in a hole
@illy80HD Exact same boat here. Sorry you’re feeling it too, it really really sucks
@blankinthought excellent news! Here you go ✋
@WhatTheADHD yes, sometimes for like a whole day, maybe two!

@heradhdlife Yes! They prob are ringing. Went to ENT last week for a different ear thing, dr said it’s your ears regulating sound change (paraphrased). Very normal. Not an issue unless it happens a few times a week, 5+ mins each time.

We have to make it ~iNtErEsTiNg~🤩

This is exactly how I’ve done simple math my entire life. I’m 31. Had no idea it wasn’t just me 🤯 
#adhdtwitter https://t.co/KtTgfXUTrQ

@On_An_Impulse And then it erupts after 2 years, and you get cornered, say it ALL in a super honest conversation with your boss and proceed to report them to HR the next morning bc you’ve tried to handle the situation on your own, with no changes. 

Me? Nah 💀
I will stop tweeting now. proofreading 150 characters is too much in middle of the night

Recently I realized I have always loved writing because it’s the only fair, safe space to get all of my jumbled thoughts onto paper/screen without judgement. I dive into the challenge of making into to an easily understandable creation ✍️ #ADHD 

Anyone else?

Whenever I find myself on a first date again, and I think it’s going well, I might suggest switching phones for a few minutes to review each other’s “reminders.” I have so many, constantly add them. Can’t live without them. Very telling of who I am. Might be fun 💀

Can u imagine
lol this doesn’t make sense. redundant. swear I’m a writer. clearly I need sleep. clearly need to let it go, release the  perfectionism ☁️

@scretladyspider From how I see it, insurance and pharma are in bed with each other, why do they get so picky and choosy?! UGGHHH 
 (have you tried submitting an appeal, accompanied by “medically necessary” note from your dr? it’s super annoying but helped me)
@lifeinunreality Well that’s not the science-based, research-driven analysis we can rely on. Sorry you’re in this shitty situation. I hope you find a supportive human soon!
@Just_agirlADHD Calm, no. Anxiety through the roof, yes. If it’s directly affecting me, I freeze. Feel helpless, attacked. With others: immediately spring into action to help
@iputahexonyou @Sea11941760 I feel seen. Time blindness while puzzling is incredibly heightened. Don’t mind during the weekends, but tough on my sleep sched (thus overall well-being) during work week
@Sea11941760 Absolutely. But w reading specifically, it’s been years. Finished reading one book last year. ONE. My childhood past time

🧠 Insomnia: What’s up girl?
💊 New med: Well, I thought since you’re taking steroids for inflammation in your ears bc allergies, just thought I’d wake you up to say hello and I’m doing my job. Which also means I wake you up. 
🌱 Med cannabis: I tried, gave her 3 hrs!
Always thought my journalist friends wrote and reported super quickly, and doubting I could ever match their speed. And then I remembered I am a perfectionist with #adhd

@tairimisuu @jessejanderson I like it when I need that giant dopamine hit after a bad day, but damn the exhaustion afterwards is absolutely awful. followed by lack of motivation, no desire/willpower(?) to do anything that requires effort. sometimes for days. what a cycle we live!

@heradhdlife Exactly right. And later, frantically search for the best claw clip, scrunchie or tie to twist, plop or wrap up in the most comfy position possible. Nothing too tight, pulling here, not too low, etc. Most ironic part: I’m a former hair stylist 💇‍♀️🤪
@heradhdlife (and then let’s hair down 10-15 mins later=me)
Even my dog doesn’t want to get out of bed this morning! I’ve been up for an hour, laying here and have woken him three times. Such a cozy day for him

@theHetal “I’m a good one guy lol” 
(I’m female, pronouns she/her/hers) ha

RT @jessejanderson: Imposter Syndrome is compounded for people with ADHD because we often can’t remember most of our successes.

Even the o…
@Sea11941760 WHAT! Where do you live?
@SimpleBadger27 @blkgirllostkeys Hey, that’s a start! I start Adderall next week, hope that helps my morning motivation/executive functioning.
@Sea11941760 @_pundmc That last part 😢
@SimpleBadger27 @trisk_philia Lol interview for my accountability partner?! Nahhh

@SimpleBadger27 Saw a few weeks ago @blkgirllostkeys (maybe a response on one of her tweets?): take meds as soon as you wake up, roll over and go back to sleep (or rest). I’ve found some success w Effexor. Some days it’s still hard, some it’s easy, take small wins when I get them

Then when I needed something only a parent could provide, like minor medical need like a rash, ingrown toenail, etc., I didn’t mention it. Didn’t think it was OK to get attention. Not a welcoming atmosphere at all. Plus, I witnessed my younger sisters treated opposite of me.

Today is realized I masked most of my life with my immediate family, especially parents, because whenever I acted like my true self, I was scolded. “Did you take your medicine” “Taylor, stop staring.” “Taylor, go do something, go entertain yourself.” Now ik ALL #ADHD symptoms

RT @HowtoADHD: I tend to overexplain because (as a woman with ADHD) I’m used to either not communicating clearly or not being heard. 

But…
@Misty_Melanie Yes. All the time. Stuff I learned in college and use all the time to when a store is open, to double check meanings of idioms.

@divergentdawn Definitely feel like that often. It’s ok, you don’t have to plan stuff out. I’m taking it day by day and have some minimal-commitment things to look forward to: friend visiting from out of town, lunch with former colleagues. 🙂
I’ve been on PTO this entire week. A friend visiting from out of town + several doc appts and plans with friends. Anxiety has been minimal, only a litttle in evening. Not working is THE BEST ✨

@FolliGiulia Insomnia here, trouble staying asleep. I’ve been on Trazodone since November. Helps in the fact that the sleep I do get is restful; still wake up in the night (albeit less frequently). Tried EVERYTHING else first (melatonin, diphenhydramine, weight blanket, meditation)
@jenni_time It’s ok. Take your time. Get the rest you deserve. Thanks for sharing with us
@joshytheegaga Yes. Especially if I have a lot of expectations on my plate. It’s exhausting just thinking about it

@KattNotKathy The amount of things I’ve dropped, spilled, done forgetting I’ve done today is BEYOND obnoxious. To myself, and of course others who are with me. I am so done with doing things twice and walking in/out of rooms bc I’m constantly forgetting

RT @danidonovan: 🧠: i’m anxious

me: why

🧠: it’s a secret ;)

@Sea11941760 Only within the last year have I realized I need to consciously prioritize and schedule the things I want to do. Try to make your work availability so it allows time for your dance schedule! And schedule everything (work and hobbies)+ find an accountability partner😊

@tairimisuu Ah that’s is frustrating. It’s so hard to communicate our needs in a way for the other person to see our “needs” vs a “want”
There must be a solution, and I think you can find it.

@Sea11941760 Yes, it can make sleep worse. I drew the line last fall and did Telehealth with my GP’s nurse. She prescribed me Trazodone. Soon after I started Effexor for depression & anxiety, traz at night. I still wake a few times in the night but it has def improved the rest I do get

@tairimisuu Have you given them your boundary of what you want/need to happen? “When you come for a sleepover, I would like you to sleep on the sofa bc I have trouble sleeping. It’s important I rest so I can be present when we’re together.” & that is the only option you’ll accept
@Kawthefairy I’m also a Libra rising😋

@AdhdGrief @Sea11941760 @AskADHD @blkgirllostkeys @AdultingADHD @WhatTheADHD All of these suggestions track with me! I was thinking more along the lines of “severely disgruntled” but I did NOT know this was a typical reaction for ADHD’ers. Glad to find out it’s not just me, thank you 😊

@shemfreeze Glad to hear things are a tiny bit better! But man, is healthcare absurdly frustrating! Please know you’re doing the right thing to get your kid the ongoing help they need. (A lot don’t, including my parents.) One day, your kid will look back & be extremely grateful for you both

Something good from this week: my psychiatrist accepted the paperwork my mom dug up from my 2001 #ADHD diagnosis! Last steps are scheduled for Monday: EKG and drug test. EEEGADS I get to start Adderall soon and get some sweet, sweet relief. Haven’t had meds since 2008!
